author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> Seems like EcAddMarius1Flat2 and ECAddMarius1Flat3 are generally performing worse than the previous versions so we are pushing it down tiny bit again

author: bridge-bot
content:
<amezianehamlat> re: **@KamilChNethermind**
> Seems like EcAddMarius1Flat2 and ECAddMarius1Flat3 are generally performing worse than the previous versions so we are pushing it down tiny bit again
I understand that EcAddMarius1Flat2 is overwriting the first and the second argument, which makes both points variable. What is ECAddMarius1Flat3 ?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> Have only this from Marcin:
I added 2 more tests - EcAddMarius1Flat2 is overwritting 2nd argument instead of 1st and EcAddMarius1Flat3 is overwritting once 1st argument, once 2nd

author: bridge-bot
content:
<pk910> Dora shows the block execution times on perfnet1 now:
https://dora.perf-devnet-1.ethpandaops.io/slots

The information comes from the engine rpc snooper, which tracks the execution time of the `engine_newPayloadV4` request.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<lrozmej> re: **@pk910**
> Dora shows the block execution times on perfnet1 now:
https://dora.perf-devnet-1.ethpandaops.io/slots

The information comes from the engine rpc snooper, which tracks the execution time of the engine_newPayloadV4 request.
I think you need to discount block builder from that metering, if you build the block your caches are probably warm

author: bridge-bot
content:
<pk910> re: **@lrozmej**
> I think you need to discount block builder from that metering, if you build the block your caches are probably warm
Uhm, yea, I can actually see that in the data. The proposer node always reports a very short time < 10ms.
